member.name: T:Glacier2.SessionFactoryHelper
member.summary:
A helper class for using Glacier2 with GUI applications.
Applications should create a session factory for each Glacier2 router to which the application will connect. To connect with the Glacier2 router, call SessionFactory.connect. The callback object is notified of the various life cycle events. Once the session is torn down for whatever reason, the application can use the session factory to create another connection.

member.name: M:Glacier2.SessionFactoryHelper.#ctor(Glacier2.SessionCallback)
member.summary: Creates a SessionFactory object.
member.param: The callback object for notifications.

member.name: M:Glacier2.SessionFactoryHelper.#ctor(Ice.InitializationData,Glacier2.SessionCallback)
member.summary: Creates a SessionFactory object.
member.param: The initialization data to use when creating the communicator.
The callback object for notifications.

member.name: M:Glacier2.SessionFactoryHelper.#ctor(Ice.Properties,Glacier2.SessionCallback)
member.summary: Creates a SessionFactory object.
member.param: The properties to use when creating the communicator.
The callback object for notifications.

member.name: M:Glacier2.SessionFactoryHelper.setRouterIdentity(Ice.Identity)
member.summary: Set the router object identity.
member.param: The Glacier2 router's identity.

member.name: M:Glacier2.SessionFactoryHelper.getRouterIdentity
member.summary: Returns the object identity of the Glacier2 router.

member.name: M:Glacier2.SessionFactoryHelper.setRouterHost(System.String)
member.summary: Sets the host on which the Glacier2 router runs.
member.param: The host name (or IP address) of the router host.

member.name: M:Glacier2.SessionFactoryHelper.getRouterHost
member.summary: Returns the host on which the Glacier2 router runs.

member.name: M:Glacier2.SessionFactoryHelper.setSecure(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Sets whether to connect with the Glacier2 router securely.
member.param: If true, the client connects to the router via SSL; otherwise, the client connects via TCP.

member.name: M:Glacier2.SessionFactoryHelper.getSecure
member.summary: Returns whether the session factory will establish a secure connection to the Glacier2 router.

member.name: M:Glacier2.SessionFactoryHelper.setTimeout(System.Int32)
member.summary: Sets the connect and connection timeout for the Glacier2 router.
member.param: The timeout in milliseconds. A zero or negative timeout value indicates that the router proxy has no associated timeout.

member.name: M:Glacier2.SessionFactoryHelper.getTimeout
member.summary: Returns the connect and connection timeout associated with the Glacier2 router.

member.name: M:Glacier2.SessionFactoryHelper.setPort(System.Int32)
member.summary: Sets the Glacier2 router port to connect to.
member.param: The port. If 0, then the default port (4063 for TCP or 4064 for SSL) is used.

member.name: M:Glacier2.SessionFactoryHelper.getPort
member.summary: Returns the Glacier2 router port to connect to.

members.member:
Returns the initialization data used to initialize the communicator.
@return The initialization data.

member.name: M:Glacier2.SessionFactoryHelper.setConnectContext(System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary{System.String,System.String})
member.summary: Sets the request context to use while establishing a connection to the Glacier2 router.
member.param: The request context.

member.name: M:Glacier2.SessionFactoryHelper.connect
member.summary:
Connects to the Glacier2 router using the associated SSL credentials.
Once the connection is established, SesssionCallback.connected is called on the callback object; upon failure, SessionCallback.connectFailed is called with the exception.

member.name: M:Glacier2.SessionFactoryHelper.connect(System.String,System.String)
member.summary:
Connect the Glacier2 session using user name and password credentials.
Once the connection is established, SessionCallback.connected is called on the callback object; upon failure, SessionCallback.connectFailed is called with the exception.
member.param: The user name.
The password.

member.name: T:Glacier2.SessionHelper
member.summary: A helper class for using Glacier2 with GUI applications.

member.name: M:Glacier2.SessionHelper.#ctor(Glacier2.SessionCallback,Ice.InitializationData)
member.summary: Creates a Glacier2 session.
member.param: The callback for notifications about session establishment.
The Ice.InitializationData for initializing the communicator.

member.name: M:Glacier2.SessionHelper.destroy
member.summary:
Destroys the Glacier2 session.
Once the session has been destroyed, SessionCallback.disconnected is called on the associated callback object.

member.name: M:Glacier2.SessionHelper.communicator
member.summary: Returns the session's communicator object.

member.name: M:Glacier2.SessionHelper.categoryForClient
member.summary: Returns the category to be used in the identities of all of the client's callback objects. Clients must use this category for the router to forward callback requests to the intended client.
member.returns: The category. Throws SessionNotExistException No session exists

member.name: M:Glacier2.SessionHelper.addWithUUID(Ice.Object)
member.summary: Adds a servant to the callback object adapter's Active Servant Map with a UUID.
member.param: The servant to add.
member.returns: The proxy for the servant. Throws SessionNotExistException if no session exists.

member.name: M:Glacier2.SessionHelper.session
member.summary: Returns the Glacier2 session proxy. If the session hasn't been established yet, or the session has already been destroyed, throws SessionNotExistException.
member.returns: The session proxy, or throws SessionNotExistException if no session exists.

member.name: M:Glacier2.SessionHelper.isConnected
member.summary: Returns true if there is an active session, otherwise returns false.
member.returns: true if session exists or false if no session exists.

member.name: M:Glacier2.SessionHelper.objectAdapter
member.summary: Returns an object adapter for callback objects, creating it if necessary.
member.return: The object adapter. throws SessionNotExistException if no session exists.

member.name: M:Glacier2.SessionHelper.connect(System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary{System.String,System.String})
member.summary:
Connects to the Glacier2 router using the associated SSL credentials.
Once the connection is established, SessionCallback.connected is called on the callback object; upon failure, SessionCallback.exception is called with the exception.
member.param: The request context to use when creating the session.

member.name: M:Glacier2.SessionHelper.connect(System.String,System.String,System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary{System.String,System.String})
member.param: The user name.
The password.
The request context to use when creating the session.

member.summary: Keep the calling client's session with this router alive.

member.name: M:Glacier2.AMI_Router_refreshSession.ice_response
member.summary: ice_response indicates that the operation completed successfully.

member.name: T:Glacier2.SessionCallback
member.summary: A callback class to get notifications of status changes in the Glacier2 session. All callbacks on the SessionCallback interface occur in the main swing thread.

member.name: M:Glacier2.SessionCallback.createdCommunicator(Glacier2.SessionHelper)
member.summary: Notifies the application that the communicator was created.
member.param: The Glacier2 session.

member.name: M:Glacier2.SessionCallback.connected(Glacier2.SessionHelper)
member.summary: Notifies the application that the Glacier2 session has been established.
member.param: The established session.

member.name: M:Glacier2.SessionCallback.disconnected(Glacier2.SessionHelper)
member.summary: Notifies the application that the Glacier2 session has been disconnected.
member.param: The disconnected session.

member.name: M:Glacier2.SessionCallback.connectFailed(Glacier2.SessionHelper,System.Exception)
member.summary: Notifies the application that the Glacier2 session establishment failed.
member.param: The session reporting the connection failure.
The exception.

member.name: T:Glacier2.PermissionDeniedException
member.summary: This exception is raised if a client is denied the ability to create a session with the router.

member.name: T:Glacier2.SessionNotExistException
member.summary: This exception is raised if a client tries to destroy a session with a router, but no session exists for the client.

member.name: T:Glacier2.RouterPrxHelper
member.summary: The Glacier2 specialization of the Ice.Router interface.

member.name: M:Glacier2.RouterPrxHelper.createSession(System.String,System.String)
member.summary:
Create a per-client session with the router. If a SessionManager has been installed, a proxy to a Session object is returned to the client. Otherwise, null is returned and only an internal session (i.e., not visible to the client) is created.
If a session proxy is returned, it must be configured to route through the router that created it. This will happen automatically if the router is configured as the client's default router at the time the session proxy is created in the client process, otherwise the client must configure the session proxy explicitly.
member.returns: A proxy for the newly created session, or null if no SessionManager has been installed.
member.param: The user id for which to check the password.
The password for the given user id.
member.exception: Raised if the password for the given user id is not correct, or if the user is not allowed access.
Raised if the session cannot be created.

member.name: M:Glacier2.RouterPrxHelper.createSession(System.String,System.String,System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary{System.String,System.String})
member.summary:
Create a per-client session with the router. If a SessionManager has been installed, a proxy to a Session object is returned to the client. Otherwise, null is returned and only an internal session (i.e., not visible to the client) is created.
If a session proxy is returned, it must be configured to route through the router that created it. This will happen automatically if the router is configured as the client's default router at the time the session proxy is created in the client process, otherwise the client must configure the session proxy explicitly.
member.returns: A proxy for the newly created session, or null if no SessionManager has been installed.
member.param: The user id for which to check the password.
The password for the given user id.
member.exception: Raised if the password for the given user id is not correct, or if the user is not allowed access.
Raised if the session cannot be created.
member.param: The Context map to send with the invocation.

member.name: M:Glacier2.RouterPrxHelper.createSessionFromSecureConnection
member.summary:
Create a per-client session with the router. The user is authenticated through the SSL certificates that have been associated with the connection. If a SessionManager has been installed, a proxy to a Session object is returned to the client. Otherwise, null is returned and only an internal session (i.e., not visible to the client) is created.
If a session proxy is returned, it must be configured to route through the router that created it. This will happen automatically if the router is configured as the client's default router at the time the session proxy is created in the client process, otherwise the client must configure the session proxy explicitly.
member.returns: A proxy for the newly created session, or null if no SessionManager has been installed.
member.exception: Raised if the user cannot be authenticated or if the user is not allowed access.
Raised if the session cannot be created.

member.name: M:Glacier2.RouterPrxHelper.createSessionFromSecureConnection(System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary{System.String,System.String})
member.summary:
Create a per-client session with the router. The user is authenticated through the SSL certificates that have been associated with the connection. If a SessionManager has been installed, a proxy to a Session object is returned to the client. Otherwise, null is returned and only an internal session (i.e., not visible to the client) is created.
If a session proxy is returned, it must be configured to route through the router that created it. This will happen automatically if the router is configured as the client's default router at the time the session proxy is created in the client process, otherwise the client must configure the session proxy explicitly.
member.returns: A proxy for the newly created session, or null if no SessionManager has been installed.
member.exception: Raised if the user cannot be authenticated or if the user is not allowed access.
Raised if the session cannot be created.
member.param: The Context map to send with the invocation.

member.summary: Destroy the calling client's session with this router.
member.exception: Raised if no session exists for the calling client.

member.name: T:Glacier2.AMD_Router_createSession
member.summary:
Create a per-client session with the router. If a SessionManager has been installed, a proxy to a Session object is returned to the client. Otherwise, null is returned and only an internal session (i.e., not visible to the client) is created.
If a session proxy is returned, it must be configured to route through the router that created it. This will happen automatically if the router is configured as the client's default router at the time the session proxy is created in the client process, otherwise the client must configure the session proxy explicitly.

member.name: M:Glacier2.AMD_Router_createSession.ice_response(Glacier2.SessionPrx)
member.summary: ice_response indicates that the operation completed successfully.
member.param: (return value) A proxy for the newly created session, or null if no SessionManager has been installed.

member.name: T:Glacier2.AMD_Router_createSessionFromSecureConnection
member.summary:
Create a per-client session with the router. The user is authenticated through the SSL certificates that have been associated with the connection. If a SessionManager has been installed, a proxy to a Session object is returned to the client. Otherwise, null is returned and only an internal session (i.e., not visible to the client) is created.
If a session proxy is returned, it must be configured to route through the router that created it. This will happen automatically if the router is configured as the client's default router at the time the session proxy is created in the client process, otherwise the client must configure the session proxy explicitly.

member.name: M:Glacier2.AMD_Router_createSessionFromSecureConnection.ice_response(Glacier2.SessionPrx)
member.summary: ice_response indicates that the operation completed successfully.
member.param: (return value) A proxy for the newly created session, or null if no SessionManager has been installed.

member.name: T:Glacier2.AMI_Router_destroySession
member.summary: Destroy the calling client's session with this router.

member.name: M:Glacier2.AMI_Router_destroySession.ice_response
member.summary: ice_response indicates that the operation completed successfully.

member.name: T:Glacier2.SessionManagerOperations_
member.summary: The session manager for username/password authenticated users that is responsible for managing Session objects. New session objects are created by the Router object calling on an application-provided session manager. If no session manager is provided by the application, no client-visible sessions are passed to the client.

member.name: M:Glacier2.SessionManagerOperations_.create(System.String,Glacier2.SessionControlPrx,Ice.Current)
member.summary: Create a new session.
member.param: The user id for the session.
A proxy to the session control object.
member.returns: A proxy to the newly created session.
member.exception: Raised if the session cannot be created.
member.param: The Current object for the invocation.

New session objects are created by the Router object calling on an application-provided session manager. If no session manager is provided by the application, no client-visible sessions are passed to the client.

member.name: M:Glacier2.SSLSessionManagerPrxHelper.create(Glacier2.SSLInfo,Glacier2.SessionControlPrx)
member.summary: Create a new session.
member.param: The SSL info.
A proxy to the session control object.
member.returns: A proxy to the newly created session.
member.exception: Raised if the session cannot be created.
